content: The **governor of the Straits Settlements** was appointed by the [British East India Company](/wiki/British_East_India_Company) until 1867, when the [Straits Settlements](/wiki/Straits_Settlements) became a [Crown colony](/wiki/Crown_colony). Thereafter the governor was appointed by the [Colonial Office](/wiki/Colonial_Office). The position existed from 1826 to 1946. Between 1942 and 1945 the office was not filled, as the Straits Settlements was under [Japanese occupation](/wiki/Japanese_occupation_of_Malaya). From the late 19th century onward, the governor of the Straits Settlements was usually also [British High Commissioner in Malaya](/wiki/List_of_High_Commissioners_of_the_United_Kingdom_to_Malaya) and [Brunei](/wiki/Brunei) and [British](/wiki/United_Kingdom) Agent for [Sarawak](/wiki/Kingdom_of_Sarawak) and [British North Borneo](/wiki/North_Borneo). ## List of British governors (1826–1946)
